comments:
When I tried to replace my working eclipse (GTK, build 200302061700, on
a Suse 8.1 linux system, blackdown j2sdk1.4.1), 
the new version 3.0 M1 starts with an error message:

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

Some time ago I tried to install 2.1M5 and had similar problems. When
I returned to may older version (between 2.1M4 and M5) everything is
ok.

Result of the m5 integrity test for the zip-file: ok.

How are you installing your new versions? Are you unzipping the eclipse zip 
file on top of the old install?

No, I did not unzip on top of the old installation directory, but always use a
new one and a new workspace dir:
mv /opt/eclipse /opt/eclipse1
cd /opt
unzip ...

Hi,

i have the same problem. I've installed the eclipse for the first time (Debian
Woody, GTK, j2sdk1.4.1) and I've encountered the same error when I tried to run
eclipse. I've tested 2.1.1 and 2.1 version, both downloaded from the main
download page this week, with the same result.

Maybe it's the wrong gtk version? I have gtk2 2.06-71. In the meantime I have
tested sereral vm and several builds (2.1, 2.1.1, 3 M1). No success.
The new Version 3.0 M2 is ok on Suse 8.1!

I am also  getting the same error, on  windows xp.
I tried both the versions. eclipse-SDK-2.1.1-win32.zip and eclipse-SDK-2.1.2-
win32.zip but the prob doesnt seem to solve.

Moving to SWT for comment. Looks like a potential dup of bug 46618 or bug 39160.

Vikki, if it's a dup, close it.  Otherwise, move to the right component.  This 
doesn't look like SWT to me.
Doesn't look like a dup of  bug 46618 or bug 39160.

Are you certain you are using blackdown j2sdk1.4.1?  Eclipse 3.0 requires a 
1.4.1 level or higher Java runtime or Java development kit (JDK).  Are you 
sure you are picking up a good VM?  Are you using the -vm argument to specify 
the VM (./eclipse -vm /opt/jdk141/jre/bin/java)?

I'm sure I was using the blackdown VM, it was the only one installed. Therefore 
I didn't use the -vm argument. As I wrote earlier (comment # 5) with the 
upcomming version 3.0 M2 the error message did no longer appear and everything 
is OK. So I the bug has been removed.
